metadata.title: CVE-2023-21869 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.31 and prior. Easilyexploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with networkaccess via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successfulattacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause ahang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as wellas unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Serveraccessible data. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 5.5 (Integrity and Availabilityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-router - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-0buntu0.20.04.1').
